episodeTitle: Coming to the Desert Kingdom! The Rain-Calling Powder and the Rebel Army
description: The Straw Hat crew arrives at Nanohana, Arabasta's port city. Luffy separates from the group and discovers Dance Powder, learning about its role in the kingdom's crisis. Meanwhile, Chopper accidentally ends up at the rebel base in Katorea.

events.title: Straw Hats Arrive at Nanohana
events.description: The Straw Hat Pirates arrive at Nanohana, the principal port city of Arabasta Kingdom. The crew prepares to disembark and begin their mission to help Vivi save her kingdom.
events.significance: Marks the crew's first landing in Arabasta, the main setting for the arc. This is where their journey to stop the rebellion and Baroque Works truly begins.

events.title: Nanohana Port City Revealed
events.description: The bustling port city of Nanohana is shown in detail, featuring Islamic-inspired architecture, crowded bazaars, and its famous perfume shops. The city is described as the principal entrance to Arabasta.
events.significance: Introduces one of the key locations in the Arabasta Arc where multiple important events will unfold. Nanohana serves as the crew's base of operations early in the arc.

events.title: Luffy Runs Off for Food
events.description: Despite Nami's warnings to stay together and behave, Luffy immediately runs off into the city searching for food, separating from the crew.
events.significance: This separation leads to Luffy's discovery of Dance Powder, a crucial element of the conspiracy. It demonstrates Luffy's characteristic impulsiveness and sets up the episode's main events.

quotes.text: Food! I need to find some food!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's immediate priority upon arriving in Arabasta

events.title: Crew Disguises Themselves
events.description: The Straw Hat crew members purchase desert clothing and disguise themselves to blend in with the local population. Vivi and Karoo hide under a blanket since she cannot risk being recognized by the citizens.
events.significance: Shows the crew's awareness of the dangerous political situation in Arabasta. Vivi's need to hide emphasizes her status as a wanted princess in her own kingdom.

events.title: Chopper's Perfume Encounter
events.description: While shopping for supplies with Sanji, Chopper is overwhelmed by the famous Nanohana perfume. Sanji becomes distracted by beautiful women in the marketplace.
events.significance: Provides character moments showing Chopper's sensitivity to smells and Sanji's predictable weakness for women. This distraction leads to Chopper being left alone.

events.title: Chopper Accidentally Goes to Katorea
events.description: Exhausted by the heat, Chopper rests in the shade of a truck to cool down and falls asleep. The truck departs with Chopper inside, traveling from Nanohana to the rebel base at Katorea.
events.significance: This accident allows Chopper to witness the rebel army firsthand and see Koza, providing the Straw Hats with intelligence about the rebellion. It's an anime-original extension that adds to the worldbuilding.

events.title: Katorea Rebel Base Revealed
events.description: Katorea, a town built around an oasis, is revealed as the headquarters of the rebel army. The base consists of a fenced compound of tents where rebels plan their operations against King Cobra.
events.significance: Introduces the rebel army's base of operations, a key location in understanding the civil war. Shows the scale and organization of the rebellion.

events.title: Koza's Debut
events.description: Koza, the 20-year-old leader of the Arabasta Rebellion, appears for the first time. He is shown at the rebel base discussing plans with his followers, declaring that he and the rebel army will change Arabasta.
events.significance: Introduces a major character who is central to the Arabasta conflict. Koza's determination and leadership are established, setting him up as the face of the rebellion. His childhood friendship with Vivi will later become crucial.

quotes.speaker: Koza
quotes.context: Koza's declaration of the rebel army's mission

events.title: Matsuge Helps Chopper Escape
events.description: Matsuge, a camel with distinctive long eyelashes, discovers Chopper hiding at the rebel base and helps him escape. The camel is revealed to be transporting weapons between Nanohana and Katorea for the rebels.
events.significance: Introduces Matsuge, who will later become the Straw Hats' transportation companion through the desert. This anime-original scene establishes Chopper and Matsuge's friendship earlier than in the manga.

events.title: Kamonegi the Smuggler Appears
events.description: Kamonegi, an anime-only character, is introduced as a smuggler in Nanohana. He is shown guarding a secret stash of green powder in a warehouse.
events.significance: Introduces the antagonist for this episode's subplot. Kamonegi's Dance Powder smuggling operation becomes the vehicle for revealing crucial plot information to Luffy.

events.title: Luffy Discovers Dance Powder
events.description: While searching for food, Luffy stumbles upon Kamonegi's warehouse containing bags of green Dance Powder. Curious about the substance, Luffy tastes it and finds it disgusting.
events.significance: This discovery is pivotal to understanding Baroque Works' conspiracy. Dance Powder is central to the plot to frame King Cobra and destabilize Arabasta.

events.title: Luffy Burns the Dance Powder
events.description: Disliking the taste of Dance Powder, Luffy disposes of the bags by throwing them into a chimney and burning them. The burning powder releases green vapor that rises into the sky, creating dark clouds and triggering artificial rainfall.
events.significance: Demonstrates how Dance Powder works, visually showing its rain-creating properties. This accidental destruction of the smuggled powder triggers the conflict with Kamonegi.

events.title: Kamonegi Attacks Luffy
events.description: Discovering that Luffy has destroyed his valuable Dance Powder stash, Kamonegi attacks Luffy despite the pirate's apology. The smuggler is quickly defeated.
events.significance: A brief confrontation that serves to transition into the exposition about Dance Powder's significance. Shows Luffy's strength while keeping the focus on the information reveal.

events.title: Dance Powder Explanation
events.description: After his defeat, Kamonegi explains Dance Powder to Luffy. He reveals that it's also called Rain-Calling Powder, a substance banned by the World Government because it artificially creates rainfall in one area while causing droughts elsewhere. The powder's use has contributed to Arabasta's civil war.
events.significance: This is crucial exposition that reveals a key element of Baroque Works' conspiracy. Understanding Dance Powder is essential to comprehending how Crocodile has manipulated Arabasta into civil war by framing the king.

quotes.text: That green powder is called Dance Powder, also known as Rain-Calling Powder. It goes through a complicated process to artificially make rainfall.
quotes.speaker: Kamonegi
quotes.context: Explaining the nature of Dance Powder to Luffy

events.title: Connection to Arabasta's Drought
events.description: Kamonegi connects the Dance Powder to Arabasta's ongoing drought and the rebellion. Luffy begins to understand the complexity of the situation in Arabasta, though he doesn't fully grasp all the implications.
events.significance: Foreshadows the revelation that the king has been framed for using Dance Powder, which is the root cause of the rebellion. This sets up the major conflict that the Straw Hats will need to resolve.

quotes.text: That green powder is called Dance Powder, also known as Rain-Calling Powder. It goes through a complicated process to artificially make rainfall.
quotes.speaker: Kamonegi

themes.description: The episode reveals how Dance Powder has been used to manipulate the population of Arabasta against their king, showing the power of misinformation and conspiracy.
themes.symbolism: Dance Powder represents how external forces can weaponize resources and blame to destabilize a nation.
culturalReferences: Cloud seeding and weather manipulation technologies

themes.description: Through Koza's introduction and the rebel base, we see how drought and desperation have driven citizens to take up arms against their own kingdom.
themes.symbolism: The oasis at Katorea symbolizes hope and survival in the midst of a dying kingdom.

themes.description: Both Luffy and Chopper's wandering (for food and rest respectively) lead to important discoveries about the rebellion and the conspiracy.
themes.symbolism: The Straw Hats' innocent actions inadvertently reveal the truth.

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy's quest for food leads him to discover Dance Powder, beginning to understand the depth of Arabasta's crisis beyond just helping Vivi.
keyActions: Learns about the powder's connection to Arabasta's problems
quotes: Food! I need to find some food!

characterSpotlights.development: Chopper's heat exhaustion leads him to the rebel base, where he witnesses Koza and the rebel army firsthand, providing intelligence.
keyActions: Meets Matsuge who helps him escape

characterSpotlights.development: Koza is introduced as the determined leader of the rebellion, committed to changing Arabasta through force.
Vivi must hide her identity in her own kingdom, emphasizing the danger she faces and the division in Arabasta.
keyActions: Hides under blanket to avoid recognition

mangaDifferences.difference: Chopper's journey to Katorea and meeting Matsuge is anime-original content. In the manga, Matsuge is first encountered later in the desert.
Kamonegi is an anime-only character. The Dance Powder discovery and explanation are expanded from brief manga panels.
The crew disguising themselves and shopping in Nanohana is shown in more detail in the anime.

trivia.fact: The episode title uses the romanized Japanese 'Iza sabaku no kuni e! Ame o yobu kona to hanrangun' which directly translates to the English title.
The 'To be continued' screen at the end displays heat distortion effects to emphasize the desert setting.
Dance Powder is inspired by real-world cloud seeding technology, particularly silver iodide which is burned to create ice particles in clouds.
This episode covers only pages 2-3 and 14-16 of Chapter 158, making it one of the slower-paced episodes with significant anime-original content.
Koza's character design includes purple-tinted glasses and a scar over his left eye from a childhood incident with a bandit named Agotogi.
Nanohana's architecture was designed to resemble typical Middle Eastern desert towns following Islamic architectural conventions.
Matsuge's name means 'eyelashes' in Japanese, referring to his distinctive long bottom eyelashes.
